sentences: Ta ostis uue koodi oma töö jaoks.
context: The word 'koodi' is the genitive and partitive singular form of the Estonian noun 'kood', which means 'code'. In its various forms, it can refer to programming code, a coding system, or a program. The genitive form indicates possession (of code) while the partitive form indicates an unspecified amount or partial quantity (some code).
